question.content: Which of the following is an autobiography of a Bengali illiterate woman who secretly acquired literacy skills to read sacred texts in an age when girls and women were denied education and deemed fit only for household chores?

solution.content: Amar Jiban by Rassundari Devi. She was the first Indian woman to write an autobiography and the first Bengali to write an autobiography. Books and Authors: Baby Kamble - "The Prisons We Broke". Lakshmibai Tilak "Smritichitre". Kamala Suraiyya - "The Old Playhouse And Other Poems", "Padmavati the Harlot and Other Stories".

question.content: Who became the Vice-Chancellor of University in 1969? Jawaharlal first Nehru

solution.content: G Parthasarathi. Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU): A public major research university located in New Delhi, India. It was established in 1969 and named after Jawaharlal Nehru, India's first Prime Minister. Other Central Universities: Aligarh Muslim University (1875), Assam University, Banaras Hindu University (1916), Central University of Gujarat (2009). University Grant Commission (UGC): A statutory body, set up by the Department of Higher Education (Ministry of Education), Work - Coordination, determination and maintenance of standards of higher education in India.

question.content: Who was the first woman graduate of Calcutta University?

solution.content: Kadambini Ganguly and Chandramukhi Basu were the first BA graduates in the British empire in India. She was the South Asia's first female Surgeon. Rajkumari Amritkaur - The first Health Minister of India (1947).

question.content: Who among the following advocated the ideology of "oru jati, oru matam, oru daivam manushyanu" (one caste, one religion, one god for humankind)?

solution.content: Narayana Guru. He belongs to Ezhava caste and was considered 'avarna'. He built a temple dedicated to Lord Shiva at Aruvippuram which was against the caste based restrictions of the time. He established the Sree Narayana Dharma Paripalana Yogam (SNDP), a charitable society. His Books: "Advaitha Deepika", "Asrama"and "Thevarappathinkangal". He became the proponent of Advaita Vedanta (Principle of non-duality) put forward by Adi Shankara.

question.content: Which of the following persons has been awarded the Nobel Peace Prize ?

solution.content: Kailash Satyarthi was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2014 "for the struggle against the suppression of children and young people and the right of all children to education". He founded the Bachpan Bachao Andolan (Save the Childhood Movement) in 1980.

question.content: Where did Vivekananda participate at the World's Parliament of Religions?

solution.content: Chicago (1893). Narendranath Datta (Maharaja Ajit Singh of the Khetri gave him the name 'Vivekananda') - He Introduced the world to the Indian philosophies of Vedanta and Yoga. Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose had called Vivekananda "Maker of modern India". He established the Ramakrishna Mission and Belur Math in West Bengal. Books Raja-yoga, Karma -yoga, Jnana-yoga and Bhakti-yoga.

question.content: In 2019, a minor planet between Mars and Jupiter was named after whom among the following Indian musicians by the International Astronomical Union (IAU)?

solution.content: Pt Jasraj. The International Astronomical Union (IAU) has named minor planet 2006 VP32 (number 300128), discovered on November 11, 2006, as 'Pandit Jasraj'. He became the first Indian musician to get honored with this unique recognition.

question.content: Which of the following architects designed the Gateway of India?

solution.content: George Wittet. Gateway of India (1924). The foundation stone was placed in 1911 in Bombay. The monument was erected to commemorate the landing of King George V and Queen Mary at Apollo Bunder in India. Other Architects and their works: Henry Irwin Ambas Vilas Palace (Mysore). Lauri Baker - The Indian Coffee House, Central for Development Studies (Kerala). He was known as the "Brick Master of Kerala" and "Gandhi of Architecture".

question.content: To which state of India did Fathima Beevi, the first woman Supreme Court Judge of India, belong?

solution.content: (2024). First Kerala. Padma Bhushan female judge of India- Justice Anna Chandy.

question.content: Giorgia Meloni recently became the first Woman Prime Minister of which country?

solution.content: Italy. First Female Prime Minister of Some Countries: Austria - Brigitte Bierlein. Spain María Teresa Fernández de la Vega. Ukraine- Tymoshenko. India Indira Gandhi. Bangladesh Sheikh Hasina Wazed. Pakistan - Benazier Bhutto.

question.content: In June 2022, Google Doodle honoured Satyendra Nath Bose, he was an/a

solution.content: Indian physicist. Satyendra Nath Bose He was known for his work on Planck's Law and Light Quantum Hypothesis. The word 'boson (God particle)' was named after him.

question.content: Fatima Sheikh was widely regarded as

solution.content: India's First Female Muslim Teacher. She was honoured with a doodle on her 191st birth anniversary by Google On 9 January 2022. India's First Female Engineer Ayyalasomayajula Lalitha. First Indian female doctor of western medicine - Anandi Gopal Joshi.

question.content: Kobe Bryant was a famous player of sport.

solution.content: Basketball. Rugby - Jonah Lomu (New Zealand), David Pocock (Australia). Lawn Tennis Serena Williams (USA), Roger Federer (Switzerland), Rafael Nadal (Spain).

question.content: Shiv Dayal Saheb, a banker from Agra founded the Radha Soami Satsang in

solution.content: 1861. Shiva Dayal Saheb founded the sect 'Radha Soami Satsang on Basant Panchami. The sole purpose of this satsang is to experience the divinity of God who resides in all of us.

question.content: Satyajit Ray was honoured with Bharat Ratna in 1992. He was a famous

solution.content: Filmmaker. Other Awards of Satyajit Ray: Padam Shri (1958), Padam Bhushan (1965), Dada Saheb Phalke award (1985), Ramon Magsaysay Award (1967) and Bharat Ratna (1992). 48 persons received Bharat Ratna (1954 2023).

question.content: Who is famously known as Bihar Kesari?

solution.content: Shri Krishna Sinha was also known as Bihar Kesari and Shri Babu. He served as the first Chief Minister of Bihar from 1946 to 1961. Nicknames of other personalities Rajendra Prasad (Desh Ratna, Ajatshatru), Karpuri Thakur (Jana Nayak), Spacing 7 -Lala Lajpat Rai (Punjab Kesari).

question.content: Who is famously known as the father of the Indian nuclear programme?

solution.content: Homi J. Bhabha. Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (Mumbai 1954), Tata Institute of Fundamental Research (Mumbai 1945), ISRO (Bangalore 1969), DRDO (New Delhi 1958). Vikram Sarabhai - Father of Indian Space Programme. APJ Abdul Kalam Missile Man of India.

question.content: Which Indian freedom fighter is also known as Bismarck of India?

solution.content: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel (Full name Vallabhbhai Jhaverbhai Patel). Other names of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel - Sardar Patel, Iron Man Of India.

question.content: Who among the following was the architect of the Integrated Guided Missile Development Program (IGMDP) in India?

solution.content: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam. IGMDP was an Indian Ministry of Defence programme to research and develop a comprehensive range of missiles. The project started in 1982 1983 (completed in 2008) under the leadership of Dr APJ Abdul Kalam (missile man of India). Prithvi, Agni, Trishul, Akash, Nag missiles have been developed under this.

question.content: Who among the following is famously called the Iron Lady of India?

solution.content: Indira Gandhi. She was the third prime minister of India from 1966 to 1977 and from 1980 until her assassination in 1984. She was India's first and, to date, only female prime minister of India. Awards - Bharat Ratna (1971), and Bangladesh Freedom Honour (2011). Mary Kom The first Indian woman boxer to win an olympic medal and a gold at Asian Games.

question.content: Who among the following was famously known as the "The parrot of India"?

solution.content: Amir Khusro: He was a poet in Delhi Sultanate. He is sometimes referred to as the "voice of India" or "Parrot of India" (Tuti-e-Hind), and has been called the "father of Urdu literature. He was a mystic and a spiritual disciple of Nizamuddin Auliya of Delhi.

question.content: Who was/is a successful Indian business tycoon and was the founder of Reliance Industries?

solution.content: Dhirubhai Ambani (founded Reliance Industries in 1958, Maharashtra) took Reliance public in 1977. In 2016, he was honoured posthumously with the Padma Vibhushan. Reliance Industries's Chairman and Managing Director Mukesh D. Ambani.

question.content: Who is named as the Missile Man of India ?

solution.content: APJ Abdul Kalam. Missile Woman of India: Tessy Thomas. Bird man of India: Salim Ali. Metro man of India: E Sreedharan.

question.content: Bade Ghulam Ali Khan was a prominent singer of the_ gharana.

solution.content: Patiala. Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan was an Indian Hindustani classical vocalist.

question.content: Which Indian cricketer is also known as Little Master?

solution.content: Sunil Gavasker. Haryana Hurricane Kapil Dev, Captain Cool Mahendra Singh Dhoni, The Wall - Rahul Dravid, Jumbo - Anil Kumble, Turbanator - Harbhajan Singh, Master Blaster - Sachin Tendulkar, Hit-Man Rohit Sharma, Nawab of Nazafgarh - Virendra Sehwag.

question.content: Dadabhai Naoroji was a

solution.content: Businessman. Facts: first Indian member of the British parliament, Congress president thrice (1886, 1893, and 1906).

question.content: Who among the following is referred to as 'Prince of Bhangra', due to his Bhangra music?

solution.content: Sukhbir Singh. He was nominated and won the 1996 Channel V Awards in three categories: Best Debut Album, Best Male Vocalist and Best Music Video (for "Punjabi Munde") for his first album 'New Style'.

question.content: The Open Hand Monument in Chandigarh was designed by

solution.content: Le Corbusier. Chandigarh city was designed by Le Corbusier Matthew Nowicki was chief architect of the new Indian city of Chandigarh. Albert Mayer known for plan of Chandigarh.

question.content: Who among the following was the prime minister of India in 1978?

solution.content: Morarji Desai. He was leading the government formed by the Janata Party. He is the oldest person to hold the office of prime minister, at the age of 81, in the history of Indian politics.

question.content: With which of the following language films is the eminent music composer llaiyaraaja primarily associated?

solution.content: Gnanathesikan) Tamil. Ilaiyaraaja : Award (R. Padma Vibhushan (2018), Padma Bhushan (2010), National Film Award (First time 1988).

question.content: How is Dhanpat Rai Srivastava better known?

solution.content: Premchand was an Indian writer known for his modern Hindustani literature.

question.content: Who among the following politicians was the Home Minister of India in Rajiv Gandhi's cabinet from 1986 to 1989?

solution.content: Buta Singh. He also served as Governor of Bihar (2004-2006) and Chairman of National Commission for Scheduled Castes (2007-2010).

question.content: With which of the following literary magazines was poet and writer Amrita Pritam associated?

solution.content: Nagmani. Amrita Pritam was an Indian novelist, essayist and poet, who wrote in Punjabi and Hindi. She edited Nagmani, a monthly literary magazine in Punjabi for several years.

question.content: Mario de Miranda was a from the state of Goa.

solution.content: с) Miranda Padma (b) vocalist (d) poet Cartoonist. Awards Bhushan Vibhushan (2012). Mario de Padma Shri (1988), (2002), Padma

question.content: Who among the following was known as 'Andhra Kesari'?

solution.content: T. Prakasam (Tanguturi Prakasam Pantulu) was an Indian politician and freedom fighter, chief minister of the Madras Presidency, and subsequently became the first chief minister of the new Andhra state, created by the partition of Madras State along linguistic lines.

question.content: Jayaprakash Narayan was fondly known as:

solution.content: Lok Nayak (JP). He is known for his support in the quit india movement.

question.content: Who among the following politicians used the title 'Babu' before his name?

solution.content: Jagjivan Ram was a politician and an independence activist from Bihar.

question.content: Lal Bahadur Shastri served as the Prime Minister of India from to

solution.content: 1964 to 1966. After the death of India's first prime minister Jawahar Lal Nehru in 1964, Lal Bahadur Shastri became the prime minister of India. His tenure lasted for only 19 months due to his sudden death in Tashkent (Soviet Union).

question.content: Lal Bahadur Shastri was born on

solution.content: 2 October 1904. He was born in Mughalsarai, UP. He served as the second Prime Minister of India. The Iconic slogan "Jai Jawan Jai Kisaan" was given by him.

question.content: Veteran freedom fighter, social reformer and feminist Savithribai Phule hailed from which of the following states of India?

solution.content: Maharashtra. She was the first female teacher of India.
